text: With the hottest temperatures of the year hitting the Bay Area this weekend, cooling centers will be open at the following locations with all taking precautions because of the coronavirus. https://t.co/6pxY7ljkIl

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: Tens of thousands of California homes and businesses will be subject to rolling blackouts as increasing power use strains the electric grid amid the heat wave that began Friday. https://t.co/ZNpDa6vuVG

name: sfchronicle
text:
As many as 250,000 homes and businesses served by PG&E could be affected, a company spokesperson said. 

It’s the first time grid managers have implemented such drastic measures since 2001, when the state was in the throes of an electricity crisis. https://t.co/CIBGNVPFJM

name: sfchronicle
text: The heat wave that rolled in Friday is expected to linger over California and much of the southwest for the next 7 to 10 days, making it the largest, longest hot spell in the region in at least a decade. https://t.co/Q2JQsBlcOf https://t.co/hTIaPR8xmp
